item.description: Walk along Manchester's bustling main street with local historians John Jordan and Dick Duckoff to take a fresh look at its architecture and businesses, and hear about the history that they represent. Laid out in the late 1830's by the Amoskeag Manufacturing Company as Manchester's new commercial district, Elm Street has many fascinating stories to tell. See buildings that pre-date Manchester becoming a city and learn about the origin of the bend on Elm Street. Meet at the Visitors Center at Veterans Park. The tour lasts from 1:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m. Pre-registration is required. Please wear comfortable walking shoes. MHA MEMBERS: $5.00 - GENERAL PUBLIC $10.00.
item.name: “Downtown Elm Street – Echoes from the Past” Walking Tour
